author: cbs8
title: "Fiddler Tim Smith & Friends, Vol.2" is Released to Worldwide Radio by Triplestrand Productions
text:
"Fiddler Tim Smith & Friends, Vol.2" is a newly released CD by Fiddler Tim Smith.
 KERNERSVILLE, NC, October 23, Fiddler Tim Smith, the multi award winning fiddler from Kernersville, NC, has released his latest cd "Fiddler Tim Smith & Friends Volume 2", a whirlwind journey through Tim's eight latest original pieces as well some much loved standards. This latest release from Fiddler Tim will definitely leave country fans wanting more. Crisp clean fiddle instrumentals (and one vocal tune) that travel the gamut of the tempos and emotions of life. Country music fans will find much to enjoy in this new cd because there really IS something for everyone. Worldwide radio stations will definitely find this latest cd to be a frequently requested album.
"Fiddler Tim Smith & Friends Volume 2" is currently available for sale at CD Baby and County Sales as well as other online distribution sites such as iTunes and more.
Requests for booking and press inquiries can be directed at Fiddler Tim Smith at fiddlertimsmith.com or at fiddlertimsmith@gmail.com
Radio inquiries can be directed at Dixie McCorkell of Triplestrand Productions at 763-274-2711.
Radio talking points on each song in the words of the artist include the following:
"Fiddler Tim Smith & Friends - Volume 2" CD
There are eight Tim Smith original compositions on my new cd. These tunes are special to me in many ways. Life experiences have always played a huge part in my writings and they certainly did on this project. You will hear happy, sad, uptempo, moderate, slow, reverent, bluesy, dance and jazzy sounds throughout.
"Milford's Old Fiddle" is a tune I wrote about an old fiddle that I used to play occasionally, years ago, and it was owned by my good friend Milford Lambert. Milford's family gave me his fiddle recently as a gift and I decided to have it restored to playability and recorded this tune as well as nine others, using the old fiddle, on the cd. It's a great old fiddle and I really enjoyed playing it on the cd.
"Old New River" is featured on the new cd as a vocal version. I wrote the music originally and recorded it on my previous cd. Deni McIntyre wrote lyrics and it was sung by Laurelyn Dossett.
"Lonesome Fiddler's Waltz" Is one I hope folks will want to waltz/dance to.
"Deadwood" is an uptempo and eerie sounding tune. While at a family reunion in South Dakota some years ago, my wife and I payed a visit to the town of Deadwood. After learning about it's history, I got inspiration to write this tune.
"Mahogany Rock Blues" is a bouncy bluesy sounding tune. Mahogany Rock is located on the Blueridge Parkway near Sparta, NC and I enjoy the scenery and great hiking trails.
"Black Hills Hornpipe" is a tune inspired by a visit to the Black Hills by my family and I.
"Sweet Spot" is simply about the sweet spot. I love music and being a musician. One will learn over time where the best sound is produced, In a particular instrument, microphone placement and etc.. I enjoy baseball and there is definitely a sweet spot in baseball bats.
"Careful Now" has a bit of jazz and swing in it. I have heard musicians, including myself, say "Careful Now", when a particularly exciting part of a tune, solo or song is being performed. That's fun stuff!
"We did one cover song, "Uncle Pen" and was written by Bill Monroe. I've always liked this song and it features Al Batten on vocals. It was fun to do.
The other tunes are all standards. I was inspired to play the hymn, "Nearer, My God, To Thee", on the cd, after learning the band on Titanic played this as their final piece as the ship sank.
"Leather Britches", "I'm A Pilgrim", "Blackberry Blossom" are some of my favorite standards.
"Red is the Rose" is an old Irish standard that I recorded for my mother. She loves roses and the tune.
